seo.title: About SustainSage | Bilingual coaching grounded in ethics
seo.description: Meet the bilingual coaches behind SustainSage, the transitions we support, and the boundaries that keep every partnership safe.

story.title: Coaching for complex transitions
paragraphs: SustainSage is led by bilingual coaches who have moved between Taiwan, Singapore, and the UK. We know how disorienting relocation, career redesign, and mission-led work can feel.
Today we partner with people reshaping work, relocating, or guiding community-first teams. Sessions stay steady, bilingual, and grounded in practical experiments that respect your pace.
bullets: ICF-aligned practice keeps agreements, data care, and supervision transparent.
Lived experience across Asia-Pacific and the UK keeps culture and policy context in view.
Practical, no-drama experiments that build momentum without burning you out.

approach.title: Small experiments, steady partnership
paragraphs: Every engagement begins with shared context, informed consent, and clarity on how we will work together.
bullets: We agree goals, roles, confidentiality boundaries, cadence, and data retention before coaching starts.
Coaching flows between English, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese so nuance never gets lost.
Monthly supervision and reflective practice keep us accountable and surface blind spots early.

clients.title: People designing change with care
paragraphs: We coach individuals and teams who want bilingual, culturally aware support while they navigate transitions.
bullets: Professionals relocating to or from the UK who bridge Mandarin- and English-speaking contexts.
Parents, carers, and returners rebuilding confidence after an extended break.
Mission-led teams, social innovators, and civic-tech organisations aligning strategy with capacity.
Leaders balancing wellbeing with performance across distributed or cross-cultural teams.

boundaries.title: Ethics that protect your agency
paragraphs: Coaching stays future-focused and collaborative. We name scope, consent, and referrals upfront so you always know where support begins and ends.
bullets: We follow the International Coaching Federation Code of Ethics, including informed consent and confidentiality.
If coaching is not the right support, we pause and signpost therapy, legal, immigration, or community resources.
We revisit agreements every few sessions to check progress, accessibility, and safeguarding needs.
